name: Lauren Lashley
text: Excellent and very well organized therapeutic riding organization. All the paperwork was available to be filled out digitally and the response times are great. We sent a digital inquiry through their website and the whole process went very smoothly. The lesson itself was an hour long and the teacher was great - very calm and patient and good at redirecting my son back to task. He was so excited afterward to come back again!

resp.text: Thank you Lauren. We’re happy Ethan enjoys riding.

name: Amanda Strickland
text: I have 4 children who have been at TROT and am so thankful we get to take apart in their program! The convenience of our forms being filled out ahead of time online was great. The information collected is thorough enough to create individualized care plans for each child according to their own strengths and weaknesses. The team of staff and volunteers have been kind and compassionate from day one, but they have also been up for the challenge of making the children work towards their goals. The TROT facilities has a nice laid back feel to it, which when your small toddler can chase a chicken and pet a goat while waiting on their sibbling’s lesson to end seems to be a big pro in my books! The staff is so passionate about their animals and teach the children how to respect and love them as much as they do. Forever grateful to have lessons here, hoping they receive enough donors to keep the program running for a long time!

name: Tim Appling
text: Love this place.  Instructors are amazing and so are the horses.

resp.text: Thank you Tim

name: Tanya Hayes
text: Both my children have attended this program.  Has been wonderful for both!  My son has Autism and the riding encouraged language.  My daughter began to ride because of her ADHD.  She still rides today and volunteers.  The program has helped her with responsibilities and grades.  She enjoys volunteering and helps children who have the same type problems that she had and tries to give them the benefit of her experiences.  GREAT PROGRAM, GREAT STAFF!

resp.text: Thank you Tanya

name: Adrian Jones
text: Very knowledgable and patient staff. Loved the animals-- great experience!

resp.text: Good to have you with us!

name: Rose Marie Stutts
text: The horse therapy has been a wonderful boost toward recovering from my stroke. The professionalism of the therapists and staff and the well trained horses are make me feel safe as I recover my strength.  I love the rustic country atmosphere that makes me feel like I’m at home  and tell everyone I meet how much I appreciate TROT.

resp.text: We miss you Marie.

name: Tina Summers
text: What a fanrastic charitable organization—Excellent facility!  Very caring human staff, great with children, very kind to parents 😊 and animal staff (my favorites are the friendly horses and goats).  TROT fills a much needed therapeutic role with genuine and helpful results. I encourage anyone to visit, speak to Dr Malone and her staff, seek assistance and/or volunteer your skills and time. I can not say enough positive things about TROT.

resp.text: Thank you so much Tina

name: Ainsley Kat
text: I have really enjoyed taking lessons at TROT. Everyone is helpful and friendly. I have leaned a lot and feel more self confident. I look forward to many more lessons and volunteering for a great program !!

name: Darryl Lovell
text: Great place for people, with special needs or not, to learn about caring for and riding horses

resp.text: Thank you Darryl. We’re glad your family enjoyed the visit

name: Kayley Fend
text: This is everything but a non profit organization. The woman who runs this facility, Lori, lives elsewhere yet nowhere near Tuscaloosa. The woman who lives on the farm that they use for this facility is sad. It is filthy and the animals look like they are on their last leg. It is horribly run by people who don’t seem to care about the facility at all. They do not help, they do not raise funds, they barely have anything there to even use. Be careful if you’re walking around their facility on a slightly damp day with your child, you may slip and fall. None of the money raised is ever seen, and the woman who owns the farm rarely comes out of her home to check on the unpaid people who work for her. I pray this place gets at least looked into, for the sake of the poor animals and people who work there. I will not be recommending any of the other mothers to take their children here, just as I will be sure to keep my child as far away as possible.

name: Rachel Logan
text: The wonderful people at TROT really make a difference in people's lives with their generous work. It's a great place and they're always so kind and welcoming to everyone.

resp.text: You are very kind, thank you.

name: Gene Byrd
text: Excellent for kids. Caring and preparation as well as riding

resp.text: Thank you Gene. We love having the girls with us at TROT🤠

name: Samuel king
text: Had a great exp they were actually enjoyed the goats the horses but I wish I could haveroad them

resp.text: Hi Sam. When were you at the farm?  Perhaps we can help

name: Marcella McIntyre-Redden
text: Love coming every time. Staff and volunteers are great.

resp.text: Thank you so much.  We love having y'all!

name: Lesley Hayes
text: It is a great place that loves to help kids and adults with all kinds different disabilities!

resp.text: And it’s great to have someone like you who volunteers with us. Thanks Leslie!

name: Rhondia Liles
text: Just met Margo. Wonderful place!

resp.text: Thanks, she's the best of the best at TROT!

name: Nick Gardner
text: Lovely place with wonderful people. They really care about their clients as well as their horses.

resp.text: Awwww shucks!

name: Jerry Ward
text: A must do

resp.text: Thank you!

name: brandon lanier
text: Such a beautiful and wonderful place to take horse back riding lessons the staff is very knowledgably. They also work with special needs individuals of all abilities such a great resource to this community.

name: brittany thompson
text: such an awesome place! very clean very friendly very professional.

name: Robert Jackson
text: Was an excellent place to have my daughters birthday party. Very clean cozy atmosphere here with the owners very welcoming and kind. Has a great seating area with tables which is a great place to set up for cake and ice cream as well.

name: Daria Wilson
text: A fun, little place for riding lessons!

name: Julie Palmer
text: Very nice people

name: Tina Selwyn
text: Children

name: Jeremey Moss
text: Everyone was amazing! The facility spectacular! The horses Beautiful! It was our first time riding, there was a short but well executed lesson and we were off on our guided trail ride through: lush pasture, lively woods, and scenic mountain trails. Miss Lucy and Shanda were the sweetest! They were so knowledgeable about riding and the horses. They knew each horses story and temperament, and paired us perfectly according to our comfortability and novice skill level! We will be back soon!!

resp.text: Thanks! So glad you had a good experience!!!

name: Jennifer Fivas
text: This place is beautiful!! Took my daughter ro start lessons and was amazed by the price.  Lucy and Shonda are sweethearts and so encouraging and patient! We couldn't have been happier!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your wonderful review, Jennifer! I will let Shanda know!

name: Andrew Winfrey
text: Enjoy horses

resp.text: Thanks, Andrew!

name: Tena Kincaid
text: We stopped here on our way home from a camping trip. Ms. Lucy was absolutely wonderful. She was welcoming and shared a wonderful experience with my girls and 2yr old boy. They loved getting to know her horse, Buster. They enjoyed riding and made the experience perfectly appropriate for their ages. This is a genuine horse riding experience with lovely, well cared for and well loved horses. I highly recommend Pair O'Docs Farm!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! I enjoyed the time with you and your wonderful children and dogs!

name: Desiree McCombs
text: We had a great time celebrating my daughters’ 8th birthday!  Directions were easy and not too far from my location.  All the kids rode Buster and got to see/pet the other animals.  Can’t wait to go back for a trail ride!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great review, Desiree. I hope the kids had fun. Thanks for helping with the horse rides. I hope you come back soon for that trail ride!

name: The Brutus gamers
text: Plan on coming to visit when I get home.  I love horses...

resp.text: Thanks, Van! We look forward to meeting you!

name: Cameron Berryhill
text: Very sweet couple and beautiful farm.

resp.text: Thank you, Cameron!

name: Jovette
text: Love this place! Love their horse trails, very nice people!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Jo! We look forward to boarding your horses for you.

name: Jay Millikan
text: Karen always has everything running smoothly.  My son and I had a great visit.

name: Jeremy Moore
text: Very friendly, great horses! Enjoy the conversations! We come here about every week. We will continue to come here! :)

name: Isabel Silvey
text: So amazing and good with little kids. Took my baby cousin 2 weeks ago and they did so good with her.

name: Holly Woodham
text: Best riding stables around!

name: Allison Lockhart
text: Great place for beginners and experienced horse lovers to enjoy Morgan horses.

name: Alexia Mullins
text: This is an awesome place! I had a birthday party there last week and it was amazing! Mrs. Libby and all the volunteers were very nice and helpful. The horses are beautiful,  very sweet, and well-trained. I started lessons recently and it is a lot of fun. I have loved horses my whole life and finally get to be around them. This is the perfect place for anyone, any age, to learn to ride and appreciate horses.

resp.text: Thankyou. We want to have you again.

name: Tiffeny Weis
text:
*Update 12/15/2020*
I can not say enough about Ms Libby and Carousel O Breeds. With this pandemic many people are closed off, and isolation leads to depression. We are able to be outside in the sunshine while social distancing. Libby and her team keep the barn sanitized and I feel safe sending my kids to take lessons from her. My kids have not truly experienced the isolation of Covid. I know they love it there because they never want to leave!!

My children have made life-long friends and found a new love of animals. They have gained confidence and team building skills. The kids can catch and load a 10 horse trailer to go in a trail ride through the most beautiful country. My son is unplugged, exploring nature, learning horsemanship with the most amazing team of trainers! My daughter has gotten tough and is growing up into an independent young lady. The skills they learn go beyond horsemanship. This is the best thing I have ever done for them, treated like family.

name: K1ng Cobra
text: Amazing place! Goat tying clinic today was educational and fun. I love Mrs. Libby and the horses.

name: Tar Heel Girl
text: We had a wonderful birthday party here! My daughter loves horses and all the horses were so gentle and friendly. Even a couple of 2 year olds rode a gentle pony and we had a tour of the petting zoo. We enjoyed being on the farm for an afternoon. Everyone was so nice and helpful.:)

name: Leanne Townsend
text: My daughter has ridden with Mrs. Libby for over 10 years and has loved every minute of it!

name: cody wilson
text: Libby is a loving soul I dont believe she’s ever met a stranger she has many years of guidance to share and does a great job doing so from 4H to summer camp she’s always taking time out of her life and giving back! I recommend anyone to let their children learn to be a cowboy or cowgirl with carousel breeds!

name: voidz
text: Mrs.Libby’s horse farm is wonderful, every body is respectful and kind. They are always helpful and ready to answer any type of question. At Mrs. Libby’s you learn about different horse breeds, giving shots, and more. If you are looking for a place to ride horses Mrs. Libby’s is the way to go.

name: Cameron Goff
text: Mrs. Libby's horse farm is a magical place. Here, you will be taught about horses of different breeds, goat tying, roping calves,  and competing in rodeos and horse shows. Even through the tough times of Covid 19, Mrs. Libby has not given up on her students. At Carousel'O'Breeds we wear masks, social distance, avoid touching other people's hands, sanitize equipment, and refrain from touching our eyes, mouth, and nose. Mrs. Libby will teach you to become a tough, strong cowboy/cowgirl while also staying safe. Wear a helmet, wear a mask, wear a smile.

name: M Phillips
text:
Ms Libby loves horses and children.
Knowing her for 62 years, I can vouch for her equine expertise, experience in showmanship and overall working with anyone who wants to learn more about horses.
Kudos for the job you do - from your city slicker sister, Murray 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

name: B patel
text: Libby is a great person. We used Cracker Jack for my son's wedding.(Indian Wedding - for Baraat)  He was great. She worked with us and had Cracker Jack ready for Indian Baraat and music dancing. He looked so good . she had her two staff members there. Horse was very well mannered.  If you are looking for a Horse for an Indian wedding in Birmingham, Nashville, Huntsville,  or nearby - Atlanta area do call her.  She is reasonable with her price, professional and will show up on time.

name: Moo Neigh
text: Kids have lots of fun while learning. Miss Libby not only teaches excellent horsemanship ,but also teaches teamwork,respect , and kindness.  She has actual pros come in to give the students lectures and hands on experiences from animal stewardship to various types of riding. Students can sample everything including rodeo events, dressage , drill team,trail (both show and hobby), and western, gaited and hunt seat pleasure. It is truly a carousel of breeds with AQHA ,Paso Fino , Arabian , Walking Horse,Racking, Thoroughbred,  pony. This is not a place where kids go around in a circle being taught by someone who watched a video or rode only one style. They really learn how to be a real horseman or woman. They also have Bible lessons so it's not the place if you don't want good morals and character as part of the experience.

name: Sophie Weis
text:
Love it here, meet great friend learn a bunch, and always have fun!!!
This barn is the best bought my first horse here!!

name: Christopher Segraves
text: Wonderful time here today. All my girls got to ride some beautiful and sweet horses. The owner/trainer and helpers were all great. My girls loved it!

name: Lisa Bowman
text: Rude and didn't pay attention to little riders. Just lesson riders

resp.text: I'm so sorry you had a bad experience.  I would love to make it up to you. I can personally teach you for free

name: Vincent James Grey Walls
text: Great place to grow and learn.

name: LaShea Wood
text: My daughter has taken lessons here for nearly a year. Mrs. Libby and her staff are amazing!

name: Emo Equestrian
text: I Love Mrs Libby's Farm! It Is The Best Place To Go If You Love Horses And Want To Ride A Horse. You Can Also Learn How To Goat Tie And Calf Roping.

name: Jake Wallis
text: Best people ever

name: Christina Fleming
text: This is awesome. I volunteer here and they are all about helping people and doing great things with children involving horses

name: Heidi Goff
text: Funnest, safest, professional atmosphere I have been around in the business. Very knowledgeable staff. Absolutley love it.

name: Cj Carter
text: Mrs. Libby's farm is the best!!! Meet friends for life and get down and dirty having a good time with horses!

name: André Garcia
text: They are great!!!

name: Jayla Forbes
text: Rodeo clinic was fun yesterday

name: Khalia Wilkinson
text: Very nice place with a nice training team.

name: Charlie Goff
text: Great place for children of all ages to learn about all aspects of horses.

name: Carl Isbell
text: Friendly

name: Nick Weis
text: I love it.

name: Libby Shackelford
text: We love to share the wonderful beauty of horses

name: Cheryl Owings
text: My daughter loves it

name: David White
text: Amy and Danielle and the volunteers do a great job of ensuring folks enjoy the beauty, serenity, and excitement of horse culture. The trail ride is through beautiful towering trees, thick green grass, and wildflowers. The horses are sweet and docile...very well behaved with riders of all ages and those with disabilities, including myself.  And just minutes from the beach and hotels. Amazing experience.

name: John Hicks
text: Granddaughter really likes to ride. Very nice people.

name: Sara Cochran
text: So much fun for my 3 year old that LOVES HORSES!

name: Jonathia Fields
text: Enjoyed with family. . very nice family oriented staff.

name: Courtney Crawford
text: This was an awesome first ride experience for my 2 year old daughter! We had so much fun and would go back if we were from the area. The guides were amazing and had patience with our little ones. Keep up the good work and sharing you love for these beautiful creatures!

name: Emma B
text: I had about the same experience as the other review on here. Paid for an hour, just rode in a square, the guide didn’t say anything the entire ride. My poor horse had to be led the whole time  because I’m sure he didn’t want to walk around a square for an hour either. The place is run down and the horses seem sad and overworked. Don’t support this place, I feel bad for the horses. I would’ve rather drove an hour to Pensacola for a better experience.

name: Dylan Blancahrd
text: If your okay with walking in a square for less than the time you payed for then this is for you. The horses looked sad and definitely not worth the money or drive.

name: carlos pereira
text: First time rider.got a bad behaved horse. They stopped paying attention to the horse.it ran off. I had to jump off and hurt my back. They refused refund.

name: Rachel O
text: Went on 4/20/2019 and was disappointed beyond belief. Workers or “volunteers” are rude and unprofessional. Me and a friend paid 35$ each for an hour trail ride which i thought sounded like a good experience. However, It was two laps around the edge of the property. Also the horses had to be LED which was as incredibly lame and disappointingly it sounds.  I don’t know the name of our “guide” but he was rude and obnoxious. The bathroom has no soap but not like it matters because it had no running water either. The only kind people there were the children helpers. Would not recommend ever.

name: susie Hiatt
text: Amazing people who go above and beyond. Thank you making my daughters day amazing.

name: Svetlana Plys
text: Very unprofessional staff, the horses got spooked, we fell and got all bruised up, they refused to refund us the money or cooperate for that matter, had to go get medical care! Don’t bring Kids

name: jasmine sterling
text: Very nice and friendly! Great for beginners! My 8 year old loved it. As well as my 3 year old!!

name: James Payne
text: Very nice staff and nice atmosphere. Loved it and will definitely come back again next time we back in the area 😀

name: Jon Beach
text: Very nice guides.  Our kids really enjoyed it.

name: joseph orr
text: It a great place but you can,t get a refund and the people are nice and funny it,s relaxing to they let you pet the horse if you ask

name: Aigerim Tabysheva
text: Kiddos can have a little ride with someone guiding the horse or ride around the full property with an adult (depending on age).

name: Bryan Barrett
text: Horribly trained horses. Rude staff. Horrible experience. No refunds even if horses don’t cooperate

name: Sean Coody
text: Very nice people, good place to go for the kids to enjoy a nice trail ride on horses

name: Barrelin' Monroe
text: Thank you guys so much for the tour with strawberry and quilt!

name: Robin Masi
text: Had fun riding....after 40 years.😎😊

name: Liz Bainbridge
text: Very nice courteous staff, reasonably priced...just wish we could've trotted, ran alittle...only reason not 5stars...an hour ride is around the field 2x...which is ok but kinda boring 2nd time around...

name: Paige Foley
text: The employees are nice and the horses friendly but there are a few inconveniences. It's a cash only location so you have to drive up the road to an ATM, if like me you only carry your card. We only wanted to go for a half hour but after being pushed we paid for an hour which I was ok with because I love horseback riding. I had 2 big issues and really the second one is why I am writing this review. To start, it was not until we were in the horses outside we saw a sign that said we could not even trot with the horses and we had to stay with the guide. Typically I understand but after signing a waiver (which I know you do at every location) and paying the $70 I come to find that the full expirience is walking a trail around the perimeter of the property. Be aware that if you are looking for a self riding nature tour this is not it, the best explanation for this place is pony rides on horses. My issue of complaint is half way through the walk we see a tractor spraying what I thought was water until we turned and the guide tells us he is spraying insecticide mixed with fertilizer. That is completely unsafe and should have been advised. I will not go back because of this, plus we started at 20 after and finished at 00 our hour was only 40 minutes.

name: Cathie Cardenas
text: Never open. Dont answer phones either

name: Gayle Brown
text: Great prices

name: Ray Reynolds
text: Super fun

name: Marguerite Kinchen
text: Good place for beginners

name: Veronica Amador
text: Very good

name: James Latham
text: Wow...! We get to ride them....  Wow !

name: Krystal Raulerson
text: Wonderful place

name: Yannorkis Perez Napoles
text:
(Translated by Google) Very bad attention

(Original)
Muy mala atencion

name: Aminta Agurcia
text:
(Translated by Google) Excellent

(Original)
Exelente

name: Craig Storey
text: We had a great time. Great event. Very friendly people. Awesome Kettle Corn Vendor.

name: Mark Doyle
text: Gotta run shows & events on time! The last couple of shows we did, over two hours behind on events!

name: Cheryl Christian
text: Great time with Santa.

name: James Stone
text: Its good to see that DBSC has progressed and doing good.I remember my dad and I going to the horse shows every weekend during the 1970's and our family spending quality times at the club house. Brings back fond memories.

name: Luke Thurman
text: Great place lots of good people

name: Sabrina Adams
text: It was fun and exciting for the kids.

name: Zridin
text: Went for the Christmas with Santa, it was fun

name: Linessa Vickers
text: Love it the horses

name: Diane McCord
text: Great place for kids

name: T Abra
text: Awesome Victoria is amazing guide family had a great time

name: Tadisa
text: Great first horse riding experience!

resp.text: Thank you for coming out! We look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Victoria Light
text: StarLight Farms has great horses. You can take a lesson or trail ride.

resp.text: Thanks! Come back and see us!!!

name: Chris
text: Very helpful.  Great area for riding horses, and right next to the national forest.

resp.text: Thank you. We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Victoria Whitehead
text: It's a little piece of paradise!

name: Christina High
text: Friendly staff and well cared for animals

resp.text: Thank you! We look forward to seeing you again.
